text: Ammerland is a district in Lower Saxony, Germany. It is bounded by (from the east and clockwise) the city of Oldenburg and the districts of Oldenburg, Cloppenburg, Leer, Friesland and Wesermarsch. == Geography == The central point of the district is the Zwischenahner Meer near the resort town of Bad Zwischenahn, a lake with an area of 5.5 km2 (Meer is the German word for "sea", but in the local Low German, as in Dutch, it means "lake"). == Cities and municipalities == Cities Municipalities #Westerstede #Apen #Bad Zwischenahn #Edewecht #Rastede #Wiefelstede ==References== == Other websites == * * Parklandschaft Ammerland Tourism website * Führs & Fröhling Website Category:Districts of Lower Saxony
title: Ammerland
